faq_subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our student program
faq1_question: What are the requirements to join?
faq1_answer: To join our program, you need to be enrolled in a recognized educational institution, pass our screening process, and be willing to commit at least 8-12 hours per week to volunteer activities with residents in the care facility.
faq2_question: How does the volunteer arrangement work?
faq2_answer: Instead of paying rent, students contribute through volunteer work at the care facility. Weekly volunteer hours typically range from 8-12 hours depending on the specific care home. This arrangement provides rent-free accommodation while creating meaningful intergenerational connections.
faq3_question: What kind of support will I receive?
faq3_answer: Our team provides ongoing support including orientation, regular check-ins, volunteer training, and community events. We are always available to help ensure a positive experience for both you and the care facility residents and staff.
faq4_question: How long does the matching process take?
faq4_answer: The matching process typically takes 2-4 weeks from application to move-in. This includes screening, interviews, match suggestions, in-person meetings, and finalizing agreements. We take time to ensure quality matches that work for everyone involved.
